q1: What security headers should I look for?
a1: Key security headers: Content-Security-Policy, Strict-Transport-Security, X-Content-Type-Options, X-Frame-Options, and Referrer-Policy.
q2: How do I get HTTP headers to analyze?
a2: Use browser DevTools (Network tab), curl -I command, or paste headers from any HTTP response.
a3: Headers are grouped by function: Security (protection), Caching (performance), CORS (cross-origin), Content (payload), and Info (server details).
a4: CSP is a security header that controls which resources (scripts, styles, images) the browser is allowed to load, preventing XSS attacks.
